ratings.comment: If you have the chance to take a class with Pat, do it. She is so experienced and passionate and truly cares so much about her students and their success. She brings such fun energy and knowledge to class - I learned so much from her. She is one of the tougher 335 graders, but it was absolutely worth it and so helpful for me.

Such a great professor and a really great class. Had a lot of guest speakers that I was excited to come in for and they gave great insight and advice. Every lecture helped improve my skills. Pat is a very knowledgeable professor and really cares about her students. Definitely take a class with her if you can!

If you have a chance - TAKE A CLASS WITH PAT!!! Pat is the best professor I have ever had at UW. She is so experienced and just really gets how to connect with students and teach a class. I fell in love with journalism because of her. She is very easy to reach outside of class and always gets back to you super quickly. I can't recommend her enough.

Pat is amazing. She has so much experience in broadcast journalism, and it definitely shows. She is a tough grader but offers great constructive feedback that will ultimately go a long way to making you a successful student in her class. She is hilarious and is always down to meet outside of class (as long as she doesn't miss a Brewers game).

Pat was incredible. Best professor in the J School. She makes you work for your grade but the assignments are relatively easy and she gives good feedback. I looked forward to her lectures (very small, class ends super early) and would hangout in office hours a lot. She's an amazing educator and person.
Pat runs her class as if you are a part of a newsroom. She gives the students basically all the say in what they want to write about and how they want to run their newsroom. Take initiative!

I'm so glad I chose Pat for my 335 professor. Instead of writing a bunch of papers, we had a few writing assignments and two larger projects in place of exams, one on the gubernatorial election and another on Wisconsin Water. She's really open to letting you take a project in whatever direction you want, and she's always upbeat and funny!
Pat is the best teacher at UW madison
One of the very few J-School professors I liked.  She's great.

One of the best profs. She treats her students with respect. Very funny. Her teaching style is very effective in learning new things. The work load is big since you have to produce news every Thursday but it's so worth it because every week you have a news reel that you can use for your portfolio. She really wants you to succeed and cares about you

Pat is the best. She is so nice and really treats her students like adults, which I think is huge. J335 wasn't hard, and it was actually kind of fun with Pat, who is very understanding if you ever have any problems. She also really knows the industry, which is great. Take this class!

Pat will always make students giggle in class with her comments. She shares a lot of her experiences with the class which I found helpful. She is a great instructor, but I am not sure if I learned anything other than the basics. Take time to write her assignments, then easy A!
Take 335 with Pat.  The class is fairly easy and she is really great to work with.  If you talk to her about her professional experiences you will get a lot more out of the class.  Thumbs up.

Probably the easiest class I've ever taken at UW Madison. I'm a journalism major and thought this would be an intensive writing class, but boy was I deceived. Half of me wonders why I pay for this kind of education and the other half smiles because I get to leave class early without any assignments. Awesome lady but not a great professor.
